verbose_text: XREF_BIBR Preclinical studies have shown that after binding of SARS-CoV to its receptor, ACE2 activates RAS leading to downregulation of the expression of ACE2, which in turn results in excessive production of Ang II. XREF_BIBR XREF_BIBR XREF_BIBR XREF_BIBR Therefore, ACE2 plays a dual role in COVID-19 : Initially, it acts as a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 entry, then, in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection, ACE2 is downregulated, which increases Ang II.
